Regardless of whether you are a DEMOCRAT OR A REPUBLICAN... I think we can ALL AGREE that when we elect people to represent us and they campaign on a platform, we expect them to follow through with their campaign promises. 

Americans across the political spectrum, REPUBLICANS AND DEMOCRATS are fed up with polished politicians serving the deep pockets of their special interest donors rather than serving the interest of the citizens who elected them. 

That is what my rant was about. 
It was not about guns in a football stadium. 

ACCOUNTABILITY. 

Finally in this state as is happening around the nation, more people are paying attention to what their elected representatives are doing. 

That is a good thing. 

We need to get career politicians out of office and elect people in our state who know what its like to live and work in real world arkansas... 
Too many of our "politicians" are so far removed from what it is like to try to live and survive in this state where we are over regulated and over taxed to the hilt. 

Lets use this opportunity as a learning experiance ... and find people among ourselves to run for office at mid terms and replace the people who are not serving our interests.. 

Only when the good folks of this state take our state back and begin rolling back some of the regulations, taxes and restrictions will we begin to experience the joy of true liberty as ouf Founding Fathers envisioned when they drafted the Constitution and Bill of Rights. 

Remember... Rights are not given by the government and must not be taken or regulated by the government. 

Thank you for sharing my post.... for your responses in this thread... and for loving our country. ! 
Jan Morgan

This is a very special day for me on a personal level .. 

On this night, VALENTINES DAY, four years ago, Bob Paskvich PROPOSED and I said, "YES"‚Ä¶..

My dear Bob, 
I said "yes" without hesitation, knowing I am the luckiest woman in the world, about to embark on blessings beyond my wildest dreams.

In every woman, there's still that little girl who dreams of finding her handsome prince and living happily ever after‚Ä¶

From the moment you walked in to my life, I knew, you were my Prince and from that day forward, the reality of life with you has exceeded all my dreams.

It seems that all my life, I've been making my way to YOU‚Ä¶.My biggest regret is that it took me so long to get here.

I am so thankful for:
* your masculine strength balanced by your gentle ways, 
* your integrity and work ethic, 
* your brilliant mind yet humble disposition, 
* your compassionate spirit and the way you believe in me, what I stand for, 
* the personal sacrifices you've made to keep me safe in the face of threats that accompany my public exposure, 
* your passion for your country and all that is honorable and just..
* and the way you tear up when I'm delivering a public speech even though you've seen and heard it over and over again‚Ä¶ 

You are my "ideal" man, Robert Lawrence Paskvich! 

I'm so thankful that during 25 years of being single, you had not "given up" and settled for "acceptable" simply to fill the void.

I'm so thankful that you believed in chemistry, that it was worth holding out and waiting for. Lucky me. 

These first four years have been the best four years of my life‚Ä¶. and‚Ä¶ every day with you is so precious to me. 

When I said "I do", I meant that "I will" be yours for the rest of my life, and I can't wait to spend every amazing moment that I have left with the man who is truly my Knight in Shining Armor, the man of my dreams and love of my life!

You once said you wanted to spend your life trying to be the best thing that ever happened to me.
That's already a done deal.. mission accomplished.
How about we just relax now and enjoy the ride! 

I love YOU "Paks" 
Happy Valentines Day, baby!

Dec. 3rd

Dec. 10th

This class covers classroom basics in defensive marksmanship, simulation training on The GunFighter Simulation Unit which puts students in scenarios like home invasions, parking lot assaults, active shooter in businesses, etc.

The latest on the delegates fight: 

FEDERAL COURT SIDES WITH GRASSROOTS ACTIVISTS: RNC DELEGATES ARE BOUND TO FOLLOW ELECTION RESULTS

Delegates Remain Committed to Donald J. Trump; 
Anti-Trump Effort Dealt Crippling Blow

(New York) July 11, 2016 ‚Äì Senior United States District Judge Robert E. Payne today ruled in favor of Trump campaign delegates who had argued ‚Äì in line with overwhelming public opinion ‚Äì that RNC delegates must follow election results and that delegates cannot be stolen at the national convention. Delegate Beau Correll, Jr., had brought the suit against the Commonwealth of Virginia hoping to reject the will of the voters, but was soundly defeated.

Specifically, the Court found that RNC Rule 16, which binds delegates based on their election results, "is in effect presently and that it controls the allocation and binding of delegates as to their voting at convention." (p. 6) The Court held that the Plaintiff's "expert testimony" from Erling 'Curly' Haugland was not credible, lacked "textual support," (p.6) and that "delegates are bound by RNC Rule 16." (p. 7)

Further, the Court found that by signing the "Declaration and Statement of Qualification," RNC delegates are bound by RNC Rule 16(c)(2) (p. 10), and that this Declaration obligated Correll to vote in accordance with Republican Party rules and Virginia's election results. (p. 46)

Trump Campaign Attorney and former FEC Chairman Don McGahn issued the following statement:

"The court has confirmed what we have said all along: Rule 16 is in effect and thus delegates, including Correll, are bound to vote in accordance with the election results. The court did not buy what Curly Haugland was selling, and noted that his testimony has no support in the rule's text and was contradicted by his own book, Unbound. This case puts his unbound theory to rest, and is a fatal blow to the Anti-Trump agitators."

Well.. here's what my Glock and I have to say about that:

Rapid Fire Drills for New Shooters! 

I just wrapped up teaching a full day pistol class at my range, The Gun Cave, in Hot Springs, Arkansas... 
Many of the students were NEW shooters. 

AFTER they shoot their qualification targets, I like them to shoot "self defense threat targets" so they experience double taps, triple taps, and work up to rapidly emptying a magazine while  maintaining control of the gun and grouping their shots. 

I put an instructor on every student to ensure safe gun handling and proper technique.. 

Today there were people from four different states in my class ..

Wait until you see her grouping from a rapid fire ! 
Pretty impressive for a new shooter !

My dear Bob, 
I said "yes" without hesitation, knowing I am the luckiest woman in the world, about to embark on blessings beyond my wildest dreams.

LIMITED SPOTS LEFT IN MY ALABAMA CLASS!

This class is several hours in length and is very unique. 

It is a perfect class for people who have handled guns much of their lives as well as those who are beginners who are comtemplating gun ownership and carrying a gun in public for self defense.

In this "Responsibly Armed Citizen" class, I will be covering a number of things including:

* Criteria for establishing your personal boundaries with your gun.
(Each person's journedy on the road to armed self defense is intensely personal. I will give you the criteria to help you decide your boundaries in advance so when a crisis hits, you are more likely to make the right decision for YOU.)

* Establishing tactical confidence...
(Shooting at a paper target several times a year does NOT prepare you as a concealed or open carry citizen to handle a lethal force situation. When a crisis hits, you can only fall back on your level of training. If you do not train for potential real life situations, where does that leave you? I will be sharing some training options to better prepare you for an armed conflict. )

* What to do AFTER you have been involved in a lethal force shooting or a situation where you had to pull a gun.
(Most people have never given much thought to what happens should they have to use lethal force.... after the fact.. or if they have to pull a gun in self defense to stop a threat but do not pull the trigger. I will be covering the legal ramafications to armed self defense.. what to do.. what NOT to do.. )

My main complaint about too many churches today: 

If Jesus walked in to your church, would He respond as He did at the Temple... Kicking over tables and chairs because of misplaced priorities and extravagance on material things?

Disclaimer: yes I know pastors pay taxes.. :) 
Churches, however, are tax exempt.
Other than that, the photos in this meme represent some of the reasons many people no longer attend, join, and tithe to churches.
The meme below, ( created by occupy democrats) is where the anti Christian movement is headed and the extravagance of the mega wealth churches is giving that movement plenty of ammunition to work with. 
( as usual, occupy democrats gets it partially wrong, as pastors do pay taxes on their salaries) however, there is also much truth here. 

If churches truly want liberty and freedom to preach without government interference, they should opt out of tax exempt status. 

What I support actually gives churches BACK the freedom they want to begin with. 

Because of tax exemption, pastors are not allowed to tell you who to vote for or who not to vote for.

 Early preachers in our history told the saints the truth without fear from the government. 

The law against churches intervening in political campaigns was passed by the US Congress in 1954. 

Since then, the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) has been successful in using the law to revoke the tax-exempt status of churches that do not allow the government to control the speech of the pastors. 

No, I'm not for taxing all churches .. I am for churches in their own, refusing tax exempt status, ( which some have done) so the speech of the pastor is not controlled by the government. 

The government never gives without strings attached .. 
Cut the strings for true liberty. 

- 2016 Jan Morgan

Ever wanted to know what it looks like BEHIND the super trap of an indoor shooting range? 

Here it is.. At this moment, I am literally behind the trap adding a dozen bags of fresh rubber .

I did want to share this pic of two of my students, Stephen and Donna Kriz who traveled from Oklahoma and stayed late for more one on one range time with me after the class..

Donna, like many women, has owned a gun for some time but rarely had it readily accessible.

After two very frightening encounters where someone with a gun had to come to her rescue, she agreed to come with Stephen to take my class.

By the end of the first hour of class, Donna said the videos and information I shared made her realize, her past failure to be armed at all times was like playing Russian Roulette with her life.
She is now a full fledged gun chick and determined to never again be a defenseless victim.

I'm honored to have played a role in this transformation.

She started out with anticipation flinch issues but worked her way up to the bullseye.. I then put her on a life size bad guy target and worked with her on double taps, single hand shooting right and left hand, then controlling the gun during two hand rapid fire drills.

I also trained her on the Shooting Simulator at my range which put her in actual scenarios where she had to make split second decisions in home invasions, parking lot assaults, and active shooter in businesses drills.

She is well on her way to tactical confidence!

I LOVE being a part of these amazing transformations!

This Bill MUST BE STOPPED. 

The list of banned guns is much broader than the prior ban in effect from 1994 to 2004. 
Bottom line: If you own a gun, odds are it's on this list. 

It reads like a "who's who" of modern firearms and manufacturers, and smacks of a backdoor implementation of the U.N.'s so-called "Small Arms Treaty." 

Introduced by House Democrats, H.R. 4269 the "Assault Weapons Ban of 2015" would outright prohibit the sale and manufacture of most modern handguns, rifles and shotguns made or imported after it took effect.

It also prohibits ammunition magazines which hold more than ten rounds. 

While it doesn't immediately criminalize continued ownership of the banned firearms or magazines, it would prohibit private transfers of the grandfathered firearms. 

This means that gun owners who wished to pass down a listed gun to a family member could find themselves subject to felony prosecution.

https://www.congress.gov/bill/114th-congress/house-bill/4269/text
link_name: Text - H.R.4269 - 114th Congress (2015-2016): Assault Weapons Ban of 2015

status_message:
When there is a desire to learn,  failure is not an option. 

I have trained people with all kinds of physical challenges to safely handle and shoot firearms.... people in wheelchairs, people with permanently disfigured arthritic hands, people with Parkinson's disease and even a student with serious visual impairments. 

I tell my students that if they are in my class all day and have problems shooting when I move them from the classroom to the simulator range, then live fire range, that is a REFLECTION on ME as an instructor, not them and it is MY DUTY to teach them how to overcome those issues. 

Every student is an individual. Any firearms instructor who expects to make all students fit into a cookie cut mold and fails those who don't, is not really an instructor.

Choose your instructors wisely. 
A certification by the name means an instructor is qualified, not competent. 
-2016 Jan Morgan

I will not be on Fox News today in my regular time slot at 1pm or the 5pm slot .. I will be on tomorrow. 

Instead, today, I am speaking at the funeral of a Purple Heart, Bronze Star Vietnam Veteran who hung out at my range every day. 

Billy Wayne Thomasson walked in my range a year ago to renew his concealed handgun permit.. 
We became friends that day. 

He called himself my unofficial body guard and on any given day, could be found sitting in a rocking chair in the lobby, quietly assessing everything that went on. 

He told me that sitting at this range was the place he felt most at peace.. Imagine that, finding peace where there is always gun fire in the background. 
There were times he would fall asleep in that rocker in the lobby...  I would simply slip a pillow behind his head and let him rest among the sounds of gun fire. 

Mr. Bill have me his cap shown in the photo. I will cherish it always. 
The greatest honor, however, was that, after observing me teach others, he brought me his daughter and grandson and said, train them.. Teach them to be safe and effective marksmen. 
I did. 

Mr. Bill gave his life for America. After all, it was agent orange that finally killed him. 

He was a Patriot... A family man who, put the needs of his family before his own. 
He loved his country, in spite of the fact that his country failed him repeatedly. 

Rest in peace Mr. Bill.. 
I am a better person because of your presence and influence in my life. 
Not a day will pass that I won't look at that door at my range and imagine you walking in again.. 
Or... Look at that rocker and see you dozing off... 

Know, my dear friend, that you were cherished and will never be forgotten.. 

You taught me how to confront and defeat life's most difficult challenges with these words: 

" Fate tells the warrior, back down, you can't withstand the storm....and the warrior whispers back, you are wrong... I AM THE STORM!" 

- 2015 Jan Morgan

Today, all day, Im training a class full of law abiding citizens from 3 states, who want to be responsibly armed and tactically confident.

Finally... today, an official opinion from Arkansas Attorney General, Leslie Rutledge, regarding carrying a handgun, open and concealed in Arkansas. 

I have read her opinion (linked below) and it is exactly what I have been teaching in my classes. 

There is no law against open carry in Arkansas, (which I do every single day).. however, when doing so, expect that you may be approached and questioned by a law enforcement officer. 

If that officer decides that you have unlawful intent with your firearm, then you must be prepared legally to defend it.

It does not make sense that you have a right to open carry a gun but can not conceal a gun...

Hey Folks! 
I'm teaching a gun class this Saturday at my range, The Gun Cave in Hot Springs, Arkansas. ( www.facebook.com/theguncaveindoorrange )
This class is an NRA Basic Pistol Class, however you can also earn your Arkansas CHCL or Florida CHCL (as a non resident) or chcl if you wish to apply. About half the students in these classes already have their permits but want the training... and the other half are non chcl holders who want to learn to shoot and get a permit.
The class is $100... We provide everything you need, including guns and ammo, breakfast and you get a free membership to the range upon completing the class that day. 
You also will get training time on TheGunFighter shooting simulator, our virtual range which puts you in realistic life or death situations and helps prepare you for making shoot/don't shoot decisions. Find out how you perform under pressure.
You can NOT just show up for this class. You must pre-register because we like to keep the class size limited so I get one on one time with my students during the range part of the class.
Call (501) 767-9944 to pre-register.,,,or if you have questions about the class.
See ya Saturday! 
-2015 Jan Morgan

status_message:
Daddy... 
He doesn't own a computer or cell phone... refuses to own either of them. 
Doesn't care about facebook, twitter, or anything else on the internet.
He hunts, fishes, and grows almost every thing he eats and that is the way he raised his daughters.
He insised that everyone in the family be present and sit down together for family time at the dinner table every night. 
Everyone was expected to engage in the conversation which included everything from opinions on politics, the news of the day or what was going on in our personal lives.
No cell phones, no computers, and no tv allowed during that time.
He screened our friends and boyfriends..
Any guy who wanted to date one of his daughters had to ask his permission first. (while he was cleaning one of his rifles) 
(now you know why we rarely dated..lol)
He was always on the sidelines cheering me on for every challenge I chose to take on. 
He could be my biggest cheerleader or my greatest critic.
Though he will not see this.. ( unless one of his friends with a phone shows it to him) I just wanted to world to know that I love my dad!
Daddy, 
Thanks for believing in me and encouraging me to dream big. 
Thank you for marrying my mom, for providing a beautiful home for us, and working hard every day to support us. 
Because of you, we never went to bed at night hungry. 
Because of you we learned the value of family, committment, work ethic, and personal integrity.
Most of all, thanks for being YOU. I love you daddy!

Training women requires a "different" approach. 

I have trained thousands of people from across the country to shoot... about half of them, women. 

What I have learned about teaching a female versus males is the "mental" transformation that must first occurr. 

Unless a woman is raised around firearms, the noise, recoil, and sheer violence associated with shooting something, is difficult for many woman to wrap their heads around.

I spend about an hour of my classes working on that "mental" transformation. 

I have learned that once I get a woman in the right mindset about guns, she will look forward to, rather than dread, shooting for the first time.

If I can get to a woman before she is taught bad gun handling habits by others in her life, and I get the chance to teach her proper shooting disciplines, a first time gun handler can shoot like this. 

Meet Pam Chenault... 

Pam took my class... spent some time with me on the shooting simulator, then we went in to the live fire range and pulled off this nice grouping at 7 yards first time out of the chute! 
Proud of ya Pam! 

She has now moved up to a larer caliber... has purchased her first gun and is shooting it like a pro!
¬©2015 JAN MORGAN

DISABILITY DOES NOT EQUAL DEFENSELESS. 
One of my favorite students.. :) 

When Sharon Parrett came to me, she was living alone, afraid, and trying to figure out a way to defend herself from the vulnerable position of a wheelchair. 

Sharon took my class.. and I've spent some one on one time with her. 
With her physical limitations, there were very few guns she could physically handle. 
We found her a good match.... Started her with a Walther p22 then moved her up to a Walther .380. 

As you can see.... Sharon now has the skills to save her life. She never goes anywhere unarmed.. and.. I pity the fool who thinks, because she is in a wheelchair that she will be an easy target.. lol 

Great job Sharon! I always love seeing your smiling face in my range, keeping up your skills. Love you girl!

MANDATED 2ND AMENDMENT EDUCATION IN PUBLIC SCHOOLS

Finally, a legislator in this country understands that, without the 2nd Amendment, there is no way to defend the remaining Bill of Rights!

Representative Alan Clemmons (R)  is firing back at the absurd "zero-tolerance" policies of  left-wing school boards  by proposing a bill that would mandate teaching the history and importance of the Second Amendment.

The Second Amendment Education Act of 2015 would give students the opportunity for reasonable expression of the second amendment at school without fear of punishment.

Three weeks of a high school student's coursework on the Constitution would be dedicated to learning about why the right to bear arms was included in the Bill of Rights.

THANK YOU Representative Alan Clemmons!
